messages.message:
:alphabet-white-n::alphabet-white-e::alphabet-white-w:    :alphabet-white-f::alphabet-white-e::alphabet-white-a::alphabet-white-t::alphabet-white-u::alphabet-white-r::alphabet-white-e:    :alphabet-white-a::alphabet-white-l::alphabet-white-e::alphabet-white-r::alphabet-white-t:
Hey folks! Wanted to announce that accuracy tests are now available (*internal preview)* on AI Hub Prod! To test it out, simply navigate to any app and click on “Accuracy tests” (see screenshot). From there you should be able to create a ground truth dataset (either using the project files or a new set of uploaded files) and then run accuracy tests against those ground truth sets.

Since this feature is in internal preview for this release, there are a few known bugs that I’d also like to call out:
• currently there are some issues with accessing ground truth sets across users/ in shared workspaces — for now we don’t recommend trying to share ground truth sets across users
• In Human Review, when a document’s split is updated and saved, the ground truth set status might not be accurate
• timestamps for a ground truth updated status are not always updated
• ground truth snapshots (linked inside the accuracy report) are not always accurate
Please test this feature out and give us feedback (either here or in <#C06S4Q864LW|>)-- the team has worked super hard on this and would love to hear your thoughts! Huge shoutout to @pauline.comising @daniel @Jianqi Xing @hannah @Serena @lydia for all the work on this! :mario-highfive:
